summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, prohibiting courtroom sketch artists from drawing exact likenesses of certain witnesses who are permitted to testify using pseudonyms or first names. The order aims to protect the identities of these witnesses.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the criminal case referenced in the court order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Issued the court order regarding the protection of witness identities during the trial.

events.title: Court Order on Witness Protection
events.description: The court ordered that certain witnesses would be permitted to testify using pseudonyms or only first names.

events.title: Order Prohibiting Sketch Artists
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issued an order prohibiting courtroom sketch artists from drawing exact likenesses of protected witnesses.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The court has designated certain witnesses as 'Protected Witnesses' who can testify using pseudonyms or first names.
Courtroom sketch artists are prohibited from drawing exact likenesses of these Protected Witnesses.
The order applies to sketch artists in both the courtroom and overflow rooms.
Sketch artists may consult with the Court or counsel to determine if a witness is protected.
